name: Overview
main:
Libya is divided between three governments, each relying on local militias for territorial control. The country has been in a state of civil war since 2014, generating shortages of food, fuel, water, medical supplies and electricity, as well as reduced access to healthcare and public services. 

Health, protection, shelter and NFIs are main reported needs, for both displaced and host populations. 

INFORM measures Libya's risk of humanitarian crisis and disaster to be high, at 6.0/10. Hazard and exposure as well as lack of coping capacity are of particular concern, at 8.4/10 and 6.7/10 respectively.?
latest_developments_past:
11/09: Recent clashes in Tripoli have displaced around 10,200 people and limited the access of health actors to those in critical need of medical treatment. ?

30/08: A state of emergency was declared in Tripoli after several clashes between local militias responding to the Government of National Accord killed 26 people (including 15 civilians) and injured 75 others (including 51 civilians) since 26 August. ?
